intro: Strongylocalyx oblatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range from white to pink or purple. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often found in moist woodland or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
